slides.title: Welcome to Multiplication! ✖️
slides.content:
Multiplication is a faster way to add the same number multiple times. Instead of adding 3 + 3 + 3 + 3, you can multiply 3 × 4!

In this lesson, you'll learn:

  • What multiplication means
  • Multiplication tables (times tables)
  • How to multiply larger numbers
  • Tricks to multiply quickly
slides.tip: Learning your times tables by heart will make all math much easier!

slides.title: What is Multiplication?
slides.content:
Multiplication is repeated addition. It's a quick way to add the same number many times.

The symbol for multiplication is × or ·

The answer you get when you multiply is called the product.

Parts of multiplication:

  • Factors: The numbers you multiply
  • Product: The answer
slides.example:
Example:

If you have 4 bags with 6 marbles in each bag, how many marbles do you have in total?

Instead of adding 6 + 6 + 6 + 6, you multiply:

4 × 6 = 24 marbles

Here, 4 and 6 are factors, and 24 is the product.

slides.title: Multiplication Tables (1-5)
slides.content:
Let's start learning the times tables. These are essential!

Times Table 1-5:

  • 1×: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5...
  • 2×: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10...
  • 3×: 3, 6, 9, 12, 15...
  • 4×: 4, 8, 12, 16, 20...
  • 5×: 5, 10, 15, 20, 25...
slides.tip: The 5 times table is easy - the answers always end in 0 or 5!

slides.title: Multiplication Tables (6-10)
slides.tip: To multiply by 10, just add a zero to the end of the number! Example: 7 × 10 = 70

slides.title: Tricks for the 9 Times Table
slides.content:
The 9 times table has a cool pattern!

Finger Trick:

  1. Hold up all 10 fingers
  2. To multiply 9 × 4, bend down the 4th finger
  3. Count fingers before the bent finger (3) = tens
  4. Count fingers after the bent finger (6) = ones
  5. Answer: 36!

Digit Sum Trick:

The digits in the answer always add up to 9:

  • 9 × 2 = 18 (1 + 8 = 9)
  • 9 × 5 = 45 (4 + 5 = 9)
  • 9 × 7 = 63 (6 + 3 = 9)
slides.tip: Practice the 9 times table with the finger trick until you memorize it!

slides.title: Multiplying Two-Digit Numbers
slides.content:
When multiplying larger numbers, we use a step-by-step method.

Steps for 23 × 4:

  1. Multiply the ones: 3 × 4 = 12 (write 2, carry 1)
  2. Multiply the tens: 2 × 4 = 8, plus carried 1 = 9
  3. Answer: 92

slides.title: Quick Multiplication Tricks
slides.content:
Here are some shortcuts to multiply faster:

  • Multiplying by 2: Just double the number (2 × 47 = 47 + 47 = 94)
  • Multiplying by 5: Multiply by 10, then divide by 2 (5 × 36 = 360 ÷ 2 = 180)
  • Multiplying by 11: For two-digit numbers, add the digits and put the sum in the middle (11 × 23 = 2_3 → 2+3=5 → 253)
  • Commutative property: 3 × 8 = 8 × 3 (order doesn't matter!)
slides.tip: If you forget a multiplication fact, you can always add! For example, 7 × 6 = (7 × 5) + 7 = 35 + 7 = 42

slides.title: Practice & Review
slides.content:
Great job learning multiplication! Now let's practice:

  1. 6 × 8 = ?
  2. 12 × 5 = ?
  3. 9 × 7 = ?
  4. 15 × 4 = ?
  5. 25 × 3 = ?

Remember to:

  • Check your work by using division
  • Practice times tables daily
  • Use tricks to make it easier
slides.tip: Multiplication is a skill that gets easier with practice. Keep practicing and you'll become a multiplication master!
